subject: Dogs
lead_paragraph: A record field of mushers drove dog teams through Anchorage on Saturday in the ceremonial start of the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race. Well-bundled fans braved wind chills hovering just above zero to line up along the 11-mile run. Many in the crowd traveled to Alaska just to experience part of the race.“I decided if I wanted to see the Iditarod, I better get to doing it,” said 91-year-old Roberta Moore, of Sarasota, Fla.The actual start of the race is Sunday in Willow, about 50 miles to the north. There are 96 teams, including six past winners, competing this year.
